title: Creative Beauty Photography with Handheld Smoke Machines
summary: Photographer Lindsay Adler reviews the Smoke Ninja Pro and demonstrates how to use it for creative beauty photography. The tutorial covers the device's various modes (fog, haze, dry ice, bubbles), a detailed lighting setup tailored for smoke effects, and practical shooting demonstrations.

steps.action: Review the features of the Smoke Ninja Pro, including Fog, Haze, Steam, Dry Ice (liquid smoke), and Bubble modes.
Establish the lighting strategy: prioritize backlighting to make the smoke visible and select a color palette (blues and teals) to match the styling.
Set up two rim lights behind the subject using 1x4ft strip softboxes with grids and teal gels to highlight the smoke and subject edges.
Position the main light using an optical spot with a 150mm lens to create a controlled slice of light on the subject's face.
Add a fill light using a medium umbrella with diffusion and a cyan gel to fill shadows and spill blue light onto the background.
Place a bare bulb strobe on a floor stand behind the subject with green and teal gels to create a color gradient on the background.
Attach the Dry Ice nozzle to the Smoke Ninja Pro to create heavy 'liquid smoke' that clings to the subject's skin.
Switch to the Bubble nozzle, dip it in bubble formula, and create smoke-filled bubbles that pop on the subject for a unique effect.
Capture the images using a Canon EOS R5 Mark II with an RF 24-105mm f/2.8L lens.

key_takeaways: Backlighting is essential when photographing smoke or haze to ensure the particles catch the light and become visible.
The Smoke Ninja Pro offers versatile creative modes beyond standard fog, including a 'Dry Ice' effect that clings to surfaces and smoke-filled bubbles.
Using grids on rim lights helps control light spill, keeping the background dark where intended.
Color gels can be used on multiple lights to create a cohesive color harmony and tint the smoke itself.
Safety is a major benefit of modern handheld smoke machines; the vapor is safe for skin/eyes and the device does not overheat.
